title: Why does walking up stairs one stair at a time feel weird? I feel like I’m barely moving and I’m just taking “baby steps”, so I just step 2 stairs at a time. - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m guessing you’re still fairly young yet? That was me, as a teenager, bounding up stairs 2 or 3 at a time, and bouncing down them even faster. It did get me in trouble once… One time, during a visit to Chicago, I went to see the Sears Tower. (Now the Willis Tower, I think?) Well, the lift to the observation deck, or whatever they call that tourist area on the 125th floor, was not free… in fact, it seemed unreasonably expensive. Why should I pay, just to get to a lookout point that wasn’t even on the top floor? After all, all buildings have stairwells, right? Yep, they do! So, up I went… Being 18, young, indestructible, and Oh so clever, I gleefully bounded up the stairs 2, 3, even 4 at a time. Since I was an avid biker at the time, my legs were in pretty good shape, and I don’t think I bothered to slow down until about 15 minutes later. Every 4 flights up, there was a closed fire door, and I discovered that opening those doors had an interesting vacuum effect as I progressed higher, creating quite a windy updraft! Great way to cool off… 46 minutes later, I reached the 125th floor. Pleased with myself for avoiding the charge for the lift, I grabbed the door to enter the observation deck. Locked. Uh-oh! Not just locked, but a high-security lock with an electronic combination keypad. Ummm, nope! So I went up a few flights… Hey! Normal locks on these doors…. no problem, easy to pick. I pulled out my lockblade knife and easily opened the door to the 128th floor. All business offices and such, but figured I’d have a look around, and maybe see if I could get to the roof… I didn’t realise that all those locked doors from the stairwell had silent fire alarms…. Ooops! It didn’t take long for security to grab me, and police were called. The security chief and responding police officers seemed pretty amused that I had climbed 128 flights of stairs, and decided that work-out was probably punishment enough. Whew! I got lucky… 28 years later, older and wiser, with compressed discs from too many parachute jumps, I’m perfectly content to take the stairs one at a time. But, whenever the Sears Tower comes up, I think back and smile…
